about.description:
The GLPK (GNU Linear Programming Kit) package is intended for solving
large-scale linear programming (LP), mixed integer programming (MIP), and
other related problems. It is a set of routines written in ANSI C and
organized in the form of a callable library.

name: glpk
raw_recipe:
{% set name = "glpk" %}
{% set version = "4.61" %}
{% set sha256 = "9866de41777782d4ce21da11b88573b66bb7858574f89c28be6967ac22dfaba9" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: http://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
   number: 0
   features:
     - vc9   # [win and py27]
     - vc10  # [win and py34]
     - vc14  # [win and py35]

requirements:
  build:
    - python  # [win]
    - gmp     # [not win]

  run:
    # python is a Windows run dependency in order to get the correct vc feature
    - python  # [win]
    - gmp     # [not win]

test:
  requires:
    - python
    - setuptools
  files:
    - test.c
    - setup.py
    - spam.c
    - plan.mps
    - test_ctypes.py

  commands:
    # test glpsol executable
    - glpsol --mps plan.mps

    # test python extension using cython
    - python setup.py develop test

    # test shared library using python ctypes module
    - python test_ctypes.py

    - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libglpk.a        # [linux]
    - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libglpk.so       # [linux]
    # static library not available on os x
    - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libglpk.dylib    # [osx]

about:
  home: https://www.gnu.org/software/glpk/
  license: GPL3
  summary: GNU Linear Programming Kit
  description: |
    The GLPK (GNU Linear Programming Kit) package is intended for solving
    large-scale linear programming (LP), mixed integer programming (MIP), and
    other related problems. It is a set of routines written in ANSI C and
    organized in the form of a callable library.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jjhelmus
    - aebrahim
    - jakirkham
    - snorfalorpagus
